title: Malaria Parasitic Detection using a New Deep Boosted and Ensemble Learning Framework
abstract: arXiv:2212.02477v3 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Malaria is a potentially fatal plasmodium parasite injected by female anopheles mosquitoes that infect red blood cells and millions worldwide yearly. However, specialists' manual screening in clinical practice is laborious and prone to error. Therefore, a novel Deep Boosted and Ensemble Learning (DBEL) framework, comprising the stacking of new Boosted-BR-STM convolutional neural networks (CNN) and the ensemble ML classifiers, is developed to screen malaria parasite images. The proposed Boosted-BR-STM is based on a new dilated-convolutional block-based split transform merge (STM) and feature-map Squeezing-Boosting (SB) ideas. Moreover, the new STM block uses regional and boundary operations to learn the malaria parasite's homogeneity, heterogeneity, and boundary with patterns. Furthermore, the diverse boosted channels are attained by employing Transfer Learning-based new feature-map SB in STM blocks at the abstract, medium, and

Title: Malaria Parasitic Detection using a New Deep Boosted and Ensemble Learning Framework
Abstract: arXiv:2212.02477v3 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: Malaria is a potentially fatal plasmodium parasite injected by female anopheles mosquitoes that infect red blood cells and millions worldwide yearly. translated_title: 使用新的深度增强和集成学习框架进行疟疾寄生虫检测
translated_abstract: 疟疾是由雌性按蚊注入的致命疟原虫引起的疾病，感染红细胞，每年在全球数百万人中造成感染。然而，在临床实践中，专家的手动筛查是费力且容易出错的. 因此，开发了一种新的深度增强和集成学习（DBEL）框架，包括新的增强-BR-STM卷积神经网络（CNN）的堆叠和集成ML分类器，用于筛查疟疾寄生虫图像。提出的增强-BR-STM基于新的扩张卷积块分裂变换合并（STM）和特征图挤压增强（SB）思想。此外，新的STM块使用区域和边界操作来学习疟疾寄生虫的同质性、异质性和边界与模式。此外，通过在抽象、中等和边界水平上用基于迁移学习的新特征图SB在STM块中获得多样化的增强通道。
tldr: 提出了一种新的深度增强和集成学习框架（DBEL）来筛查疟疾寄生虫图像，其中包括新的增强-BR-STM卷积神经网络和集成机器学习分类器，有助于提高筛查效率。
en_tdlr: A new Deep Boosted and Ensemble Learning (DBEL) framework is proposed for screening malaria parasite images, which includes new Boosted-BR-STM convolutional neural networks and ensemble machine learning classifiers to improve screening efficiency.
